meanings.definition: A rhythmic work song originally sung by sailors.
meanings.sent1: The sailors sang a chantey while pulling the heavy ropes together.
meanings.sent2: The crew sang a chantey to keep their spirits high during the long voyage.
meanings.sent3: The chantey the sailors sang was so catchy, even the seagulls joined in!
meanings.sent4: The chantey echoed through the ship, lifting the sailors' weary hearts.
meanings.sent5: The chantey's powerful rhythm made the hard work feel like a dance.

meanings.definition: A song sung by a group in unison.
meanings.sent1: The children sang a chantey together at the school concert.
meanings.sent2: The choir performed a beautiful chantey that moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent3: The chantey the friends sang was so harmonious, it attracted a crowd of listeners.
meanings.sent4: The chantey united the voices of the group, creating a mesmerizing melody.
meanings.sent5: The chantey's melody resonated in perfect harmony among the singers.
